title: Ontology-Based Sustainable Energy Mathematical Modeling for [Large-Scale] Applications

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of foundational mathematics (algebra, functions, statistics)
context.additional_context: Parallel operation of a smartphone-based mobile learning platform and weekly offline workshops.

learning_goals: Learners can interpret mathematical models of sustainable energy systems according to ontology structures.
Learners can process data using regression analysis and simulation tools for energy efficiency calculations.

In team-based problem-solving activities (4 members per team), learners utilize all five stages of a mathematical decision-making framework (problem definition → data collection → modeling → analysis → action plan development) to derive optimal solutions for real industrial cases (e.g., production line optimization) and can earn an "excellent" rating in at least two of three evaluation criteria (clarity, logicality, feasibility)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
